metadata.name: Vortex #17
metadata.description:
"Vortex" is a free collection (giveaway) mainly for holders of "Virtual Treasure" https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/21113
which had been added automatically in the whitelist and free for everyone :) 

KEYS:

- 1-4: Set resolution from 1x to 4x of the current dimension (possibly slower performance in higher values)
- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

----
Made with p5js, glsl

© Nov. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

metadata.name: Concordance #241
metadata.description:
"Concordance" is a study of color relationships in a grid structure. The sketch starts with a simple pallet. Then each color is "lerped" to get levels of transition between the colors. Each color of this newly expanded pallet walks over a grid of cells to simulate rows or columns of gradients. 

Built with p5.js 

Export to a PNG format at several different sizes.
- Press s: save the current render size
- Press t: scale to screen size
- Press f: full print size (see features for dimensions)

License: CC-BY

Please find me on Twitter and Instagram at @natenolting.

"You know what I want to say."

敬自由

"You know what I want to say."

敬自由

metadata.name: AUTOJOURNEYPAINT #197
metadata.description:
An automatic painting journey

AUTOJOURNEYPAINT  uses a series of custom built walkers to make plots with a great variety of properties, including packing gaps, directions and propensity for turning. These plots are then drawn over with varying, incremented pixel brushes.

AUTOJOURNEYPAINT chooses color for itself from a broad list of more than 100 colors. It selects a palette of 8 but might not use all of them.

The background consists of a single color at the back and then one channel (either r, g, b) of the same color iterating from 0 to 255 while also iterating over a number of pixels within a border, all fixed to a pixel grid of variable size. The iteration over pixel numbers means the background produces very different patterns at different screen sizes

If you want to know more about the variables used they are output in the console log

Responsive to screen size. Larger resolutions will implement more brush strokes.

Some renders may be slower due to more complex collision detection in some brush settings.

Press “s” to save the image as a png.

metadata.name: Versus in Motion #34
metadata.description:
"Versus in Motion" is an animated version, a successor of original "Versus" collection
https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/21865

Includes all features of "Versus" (resolution levels, switchable orientation, etc) plus it's animated (obviously) and interactive
- You can stop & start animation at any time by pressing the spacebar
- You may click (or click & drag) while in animation or not, to modify the current artwork

Animation cycle is actually a transition between a "full" and an "empty" state that symbolizes the transition between existence, non-existence,  prosperity & decline and the evolution and progress in general as a result of time passage..

All are pure code, shapes and curves that processed in a custom fragment glsl (webgl) shader using a relative "advanced" developed mixing technique.

CONTROLS

KEYS:

- 1-4: Set resolution from 1x to 4x of the current dimension (possibly slower performance in higher values)
- S: Save a png file with the current resolution

- P: Change orientation to Portrait with aspect ratio 0.75 (useful eg. for printing)
- L: Change orientation to Landscape with ratio 4/3  (1.333..)
- O: Original orientation. That is the default Square (box)
  Due to some 1:1 ratio sensitive calculations, rendering output may differ when switching 
  orientations

  For animation:
- Spacebar: toggle animation (on/off)
- R: Reset the center of animation (if has been modified with click or drag)

MOUSE:

- Click (or Click & Drag) to set the center of animation

----
Made with p5js and custom shaders

© Dec. 2022  @Uniray_net | uniray.net

metadata.name: SPOT #253
metadata.description:
A study of circles, sizes, lines, colors, grains and alphas. The composition consists solely of 2d shapes but generates a 3d look. The base colors use a random chromaticity factor which results in a wild range of combinations. There is a 70% change on a dark background and 30% on a light background also 15% change on black and white. 

Press s in live mode for a 2000x2800 download

Download a higher resolution by adding to the URL:
&density=2 / &density=3 / &density=4

Lammetje December 2022

metadata.name: Polymorph #113
metadata.description:
A polymorph tessellation is an irregular tessellation of regular polygons.
As the main tessellation used in this Truchet pattern is a polymorph tessellation and as the design morphs from chaotic patterning to rigid order we decided it was an appropriate name.

Keyboard interaction:
r - redraw with randomised tiles and colours within the same palette, other variables constant.
c - redraw with only chaos tiles.
o - redraw with only ordered tiles.
m - redraw with mixed tiles.
b - remove border.
d - restore border.
1,2,3,4,7 - redraw at corresponding values x 1000.
All of the above redraw the artwork and so will take a few seconds to complete.
Tiling pattern feature "Hexagons, Squares and Triangles" behaves slightly differently to the others in response to the 'o' and 'c' keys.
Each palette contains 7 colours from which 5 are chosen for each rendering. These are re-chosen on randomisation so may change the feel of the artwork significantly.

metadata.name: Shavings #136
metadata.description: Made with p5.js

metadata.name: Urban Disorderly #26
metadata.description:
Urban Disorderly
The Revolution Will Not Be Civilised.


//
L to download 1000x1000
S to download 4000x4000
H to download 8000x8000
U to download 12000x12000 
Tested on Chrome / Intel, Higher resolutions will be machine constrained.
But let me know and I can download for you.

metadata.name: Dapperu #677
metadata.description:
Go bold, Dapperu!

Dapperu is the first generative animated GIF avatar.

A single Dapperu has 13 traits that result in different colors, shapes and movements. Every Dapperu is unique and can be used as a GIF wherever you like.

You can right-click the image and save it as a GIF file.

You can also press [control / command + s] or [tap and hold outside the image] to save a ZIP file that contains the GIF and all individual frames as SVG images.

© 2022 Dapperu.

metadata.name: Glitchy Masks #53
metadata.description:
A big thank you to Aleksandra from https://www.fxhash.xyz/u/Aleksandra for their assistance with the code!

In this project, I explored the concept of randomness and was pleasantly surprised by the results. After a few iterations, masks began to emerge. I added a mirroring effect to enhance the visual and added eyes for added realism. The end result is a series of intriguing masks, created through the use of randomness and artistic experimentation.

To save your canvas, simply press S.

For more information and to stay up to date with my work, follow me on Twitter at @lomzart or visit my portfolio website at lomz.net. Thank you for your interest!

metadata.name: Splinter #199
metadata.description:
This release marks my first anniversary on the fx(hash) platform! I want to extend a huge thank you to everyone for a fantastic year, and I'm looking forward to many more in the generative-art world!

The basic algorithm is an evolution of the one I used in my first release, Raked Strokes. Instead of mimicking a brush with parallel segments, I'm using perpendicular line segments to define the overall abstract shape and then drawing each line in a simulated media. This approach blends my first attempts at natural media with everything I've learned in the past year.

Viewing in desktop Chrome is recommended for the best results.
Press 's' to save a screenshot. The image size is 2357x3000px
Press 'p' to pause/resume during drawing.

Features
- Base path shape: line, circle, diamond, or rectangle
- Elements defining the spacing and orientation of the line segments
- The base path painted in the background
- Monochrome, dark background, and selection of palettes
- Ink pen styling: thickness, quality, and background blocking
- Paint styling: color distribution, quality
- Shapes: triangle, polygons, criteria for insertion
- Shapes overdrawing: outlines or perpendicular segments

Copyright (c) 2022 Matt Perkins, hello@mattperkins.me, @nudoru on Twitter. Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, see LICENSE.txt for more information.

metadata.name: Endeavor #103
metadata.description:
Endeavor is a generative system structured to create abstract mountains.

When I look at the outputs, I am reminded of the things I would like to achieve. I would be curious to know what comes to your mind when you ask yourself, "What is my goal? What do I intend to do?"

Controls:

'p' - Play an animation that draws the mountain layer by layer
'1' - Default, textured image
'2' - No border
'3' - Flat, non-textured image
'4' - Flat with no border

Each of the 128 editions chooses one of five forms, all of which explore variety in layout, shading, and color composition.

25% of the royalties for each edition will pass to the original minter.

Each output is generated from code written in p5js.

Created by Eric Davidson. 2022.

metadata.name: n Forms #115
metadata.description:
Hand-scrawled documentation of abstract structures. A journal from another realm.

Press 's' to save an image while in full-screen mode.

If you want to increase the resolution of the saved image, add e.g. &size=2000 after the live/fullscreen view URL to render the canvas at that specific pixel width (default = browser sized). This will be dependent on your system specifications, but outputs of up to 8000px wide, or above, should be possible.

Usually loads best in Chrome

metadata.name: Suspiro #189
metadata.description:
Deep in the heart, beside the lung, there is something inexplicable, an emotion, perhaps a passion, that only forms and abstractions are capable of understanding. Who knows, one day I may be able to transmit this feat through art made of code, mathematics of feelings seeks to understand and extract something so sublime from within me.

made with p5.js
eduxdux | december 2022

metadata.name: BWEEPS  #243
metadata.description:
A minimalist, black-and-white generative profile picture (PFP) created to commemorate one-year anniversary of Bwople project by Gengoya. The artwork is derived from an initial sketch of Bwople which, despite being not the one that was chosen, still managed to captivate interests. The project provides a unique glimpse into an alternate universe in which Bwople could have been represented.

All images are hand-drawn work by Gengoya and composed by Vector Recite using PureSpider's fxhash-pfp maker tool.

To download the full size image on fx(hash):
- Click "open" below the image
- Left click on the image, a "Download image" button will appear on the bottom right.
- Click the "Download image" button.

metadata.name: L-Template #291
metadata.description:
THIS IS NOT AN ARTWORK.

Instead: a framework to store artwork data components onchain by including them as features in the token's smart contract. The stored data are parameters of a Lindenmayer System, which is a formal grammar that was initially conceived of as a theory of plant growth. L-Systems can model complex forms of plants using relatively few simple rules. Custom rules are generated during the minting of each token, based on the transaction hash string. 

The idea is that each iteration of the artwork can be reproduced accurately using an L-System interpreter by accessing the tezos blockchain through the FxHash API (GraphQL) and interpreting token metadata.

Reusable template source: https://github.com/x-terrain/x-terrain.github.io/tree/main/L-Template

Part of an ongoing project with RefractionDAO

metadata.name: Extrusion - v2 #3
metadata.description:
Dear collectors,
Extrusion was originally published as Project #14512 on June 9, 2022.
(https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/14512)
Due to a technical issue, Project #14512 has been hidden from the site and is being replaced by this reissued version.

_______________________________

Extrusion is a work that brings the generation of particles that perform smooth sinusoidal movements according to the evolution of the animation frames. Each frame registers its position with a slight shading, and with continuous stacking we get the impression of depth that I like to call 'pseudo-3D'.
The perception of movement is something that I really enjoy watching and I hope it can have the same effect on collectors and enthusiasts of animated arts. Even so, for those who prefer static art, the work is finished after a frame count (which may vary depending on its hash) by adding a grain texture followed by a thin black beveled frame with white passe-partout for better highlighting. the post-animation result.

The palette sets were carefully chosen, totaling 19 palettes with 6 colors each, separated into themes of environment, mood, styles, materials and other elements. Of these seven are monochromatic sets with a small rarity of being obtained.

The shapes of the particles vary between 8 pointed stars (rare), circles and vertical or horizontal bars and their trail changes a lot according to the frame count and total number of objects in the scene. Sometimes they look like they are dancing while moving around creating pseudo-three-dimensional objects.

The screens can be obtained in three different aspect ratios: 1x1 (square, more common), and two wide options (16x9 landscape and 9x16 portrait, a little rarer).

As already said and I always say: carefully chosen palettes!

_______________________________
Variety of editions is guaranteed by several features:
* Black or white backgrounds (for better highlighting of particles);
* 19 color palettes with 6 colors each where the rarest is BW (<6%)
* 3 aspect ratios: 1x1 (50%), 9x16 (25%) and 16x9 (25%)
* Controlled variety of scale;
* Controlled variety of particle number;
* Animation time;
* Shape type: circles (60%), bars (30%) and stars (10%);
* Animation with coordinated movement (12%);
* Super rare inverted move (5%)

_______________________________
Interactive instructions:
* Press [I] to change the inverted mode, if you have it.

_______________________________
Saving your .png file:
* Press [S] to save your .png file in screen size;
* Press [0] to save your .png file in qHD resolution;
* Press [1] to save your .png file in FHD resolution;
* Press [2] to save your .png file in UHD (4K) resolution;
* Press [3] to save your .png file in FUHD (8K) resolution;
(for higher resolutions, please wait up for few seconds until complete render)


Made with p5.js
_______________________________
Creator: Kukuti
June 2022 -> Dec2022
License: NFT 2.0

metadata.name: Con(text)ual #122
metadata.description:
Con(text)ual is a generative painting made from ASCII characters confined into shapes. Shapes are randomly drawn onto the canvas, then filled with individual characters from a character array. The density of characters is dependent upon the size of the shape, creating some transparencies and an organic feel to each shape.

I've long been interested in typography as an artform and this is an extension of my typography explorations.

There are a total of 10 color pallets. The number of shapes on each canvas varies from 3 to 9. The edition size was chosen based on the code, which lends itself well to a wide array of potential outcomes. Please get in touch with me if you want a larger resolution size for printing. 

I hope you enjoy the art!

Made with 100% Code and p5.js
Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0
